scripts.@comment init: Generates env files for all workflow types - should work out of the box
scripts.init: cd config && shx cp .env-e2e-example .env-e2e && shx cp .env-handsoff-example .env-handsoff && shx cp .env-local-example .env-local && cd .. && shx cp .env-example .env
scripts.@comment review: Should be run before submitting anything to pull request. Saves time and CI resources.
scripts.review: npm prune && npm install && npm run lint && npm run test:e2e
scripts.@comment start:handsoff: Starts complete environment. Requires running init first.
scripts.@comment start:env: Starts everything the node service depends on.
scripts.start:env: docker-compose down && docker-compose up -d postgres redis
scripts.@comment DB scripts: Sequelize scripts. For most uses, only 'migrate' is needed.
scripts.@comment migrate: Brings the configured database up to date.
scripts.migrate: ENV_RELATIVE_PATH=./.env-local npm run sequelize -- db:migrate --env current
scripts.@comment migrate:docker: For use within docker container, skips loading env files
scripts.@comment start:debug:local: Starts local debug server. Requires other env services.
scripts.@comment clear:cache: Clears cache API that's currently configured
scripts.@comment start: Intended for production. Starts server in basic mode
scripts.@comment start:dev: Intended for profiling. Starts server with watch but no debug
scripts.@comment test:e2e:handsoff: Runs API tests with Docker, completely self sufficient.
scripts.test:e2e:handsoff: docker-compose -f docker-compose-e2e.yml rm -fv postgres_test && docker-compose -f docker-compose-e2e.yml up --remove-orphans --build --exit-code-from api-tester && docker-compose -f docker-compose-e2e.yml down --volumes
scripts.@comment test:e2e:internal: Runs API tests with preset env vars. Probably don't want to run this manually
scripts.@comment test:e2e:local: Runs API tests with config file. Intended to be run from localhost. Faster than handsoff if you're iterating tests and don't want to teardown constantly.
